depth_step.desc: The slant depth of each step in the shower propagation in g/cm^2

time_bin.desc: The size of the time bins for the photons collected in seconds

ground_normal.desc: A vector normal to the ground plane

ground_point.desc: A point on the ground plane

elevation_angle.desc: The angle of the detector axis with respect to the horizon in radians

energy_pow.desc: The exponent in the negative power law of the energy distribution

e_min.desc: The minimum shower energy to simulate in Joules

e_max.desc: The maximum shower energy to simulate in Joules

impact_min.desc: The minimum impact parameter to simulate in cm

impact_max.desc: The maximum impact parameter to simulate in cm

first_interact.desc: The average depth of the first interaction (a proton primary is assumed)

n_max_ratio.desc: The constant used to determine the size of the shower at maximum from the primary energy

scale_height.desc: The exponential atmosphere scale height in cm

rho_sea.desc: The density of the atmosphere at sea level in g/cm^3

atmosphere_temp.desc: The constant temperature of the exponential atmosphere (Kelvin)

refrac_sea.desc: The index of refraction of air at sea level, proportional to the local atmospheric density

refrac_lens.desc: The index of refraction for the corrector plate

mirror_radius.desc: The radius of curvature of the detector mirror in cm

stop_diameter.desc: The diameter of the stop (corrector) in cm

mirror_size.desc: The diameter of the mirror in cm

cluster_diameter.desc: The diameter of the photomultiplier array in cm

n_pmt_across.desc: The width/height of the photomultiplier grid in number of photomultipliers (should be even)

gh_lambda.desc: The lambda parameter in the GH distribution (units of g/cm^2)

fluor_a1.desc: A parameter in the expression for fluorescence yield from Kakimoto (units of m^2 * kg^-1

fluor_a2.desc: A parameter in the expression for fluorescence yield from Kakimoto (units of m^2 * kg^-1)

fluor_b1.desc: A parameter in the expression for fluorescence yield from Kakimoto (units of m^3 * kg^-1 * K^-1/2

fluor_b2.desc: A parameter in the expression for fluorescence yield from Kakimoto (units of m^3 * kg^-1 * K^-1/2

dep_1_4.desc: The energy deposit from a single electron with energy 1.4 MeV (currently measured in photons/meter)

ion_c1.desc: A parameter in the expression for the effective ionization loss rate (unitless)

ion_c2.desc: A parameter in the expression for the effective ionization loss rate (unitless)

ion_c3.desc: A parameter in the expression for the effective ionization loss rate (unitless)

ion_c4.desc: A parameter in the expression for the effective ionization loss rate (unitless)

ion_c5.desc: A parameter in the expression for the effective ionization loss rate (unitless)

ckv_k1.desc: The leading constant for theta_c in the Cherenkov angular distribution (Stratton 4.17)

ckv_k2.desc: The constant in the exponent for theta_c in the Cherenkov angular distrubution (Stratton 4.17)

lambda_min.desc: The minimum wavelength of Cherenkov photons being considered in cm

lambda_max.desc: The maximum wavelength of Cherenkov photons being considered in cm

fe_a11.desc: A parameter in the expression for the electron energy spectrum (Nerling Eq 18-21)

fe_a12.desc: A parameter in the expression for the electron energy spectrum (Nerling Eq 18-21)

fe_a21.desc: A parameter in the expression for the electron energy spectrum (Nerling Eq 18-21)

fe_a22.desc: A parameter in the expression for the electron energy spectrum (Nerling Eq 18-21)

fe_k0.desc: A parameter used to calculate the normalization constant in the electron spectrum (Nerling Eq 20)

fe_k1.desc: A parameter used to calculate the normalization constant in the electron spectrum (Nerling Eq 20)

fe_k2.desc: A parameter used to calculate the normalization constant in the electron spectrum (Nerling Eq 20)

mass_e.desc: The mass of the electron in grams

sky_noise.desc: Average number of noise photons per square centimeter per steradian per second above horizon

ground_noise.desc: Average number of noise photons per square centimeter per steradian per second below horizon
